info.title: Adobe Target Admin and Reporting APIs

get.description: Retrieve the current definition of a property referenced by the property ID.

put.description: Update the property referenced by the property ID.

delete.description: Delete the property referenced by the property ID.

get.description: Retrieves the contents of the Recommendations offer referenced by the provided ID.

put.summary: Update a recs offer by ID
put.description: Updates the Recommendations offer referenced by the ID specified in the URL.

delete.summary: Delete a recs offer by ID
delete.description: Deletes the Recommendations offer referenced by the provided ID.

get.description: Retrieves the contents of the JSON offer referenced by the provided ID.

put.summary: Update a json offer by ID
put.description: Updates the JSON offer referenced by the ID specified in the URL.

delete.summary: Delete a json offer by ID
delete.description: Deletes the JSON offer referenced by the provided ID.

get.description: Retrieves the contents of the content offer referenced by the provided ID.

put.summary: Update a content offer by ID
put.description: Updates the content offer referenced by the ID specified in the URL.

delete.summary: Delete a content offer by ID
delete.description: Deletes the content offer referenced by the provided ID.

put.description: Update the host referenced by the environment and host name.

delete.description: Delete the host referenced by the host name.

get.description: Retrieve the current definition of an environment as referenced by the environment ID.

put.description: Update the environment referenced by the environment ID.

delete.description: Delete the environment referenced by the environment ID.

get.description: Retrieve a list of the default environments.

put.description: Update the default environment(s) referenced by the environment ID.

get.description: Retrieve client UI settings.

put.description: Update client UI settings.

get.description: Retrieve client settings.

put.description: Update client settings.

get.description: Retrieve client report IP filters.

put.description: Save client report IP filters.

get.description: Retrieve list of hosts that are authorized.

put.description: Update authorized hosts.

get.description: Get the audience definition specified by the provided ID.

put.description: Update an audience with the new rules specified by the request data.

delete.description: Delete the audience referenced by the specified ID.

patch.summary: Patch a specific audience by ID
patch.description: Partial update to the audience referenced by the specified ID. You can update individual fields like name, description, targetRule, etc.

get.description: Retrieve at.js settings.

put.description: Update at.js settings.
Update the state of the activity referenced by the provided ID. Valid values are approved, deactivated, deleted and saved.
Update the state of the AB activity referenced by the provided ID. Valid values are approved, deactivated, deleted and saved.
Update the state of the Experience Targeting activity referenced by the provided ID. Valid values are approved, deactivated, deleted and saved.

Update the startsAt and endsAt fields of an activity referenced by the provided ID. This controls when the activity goes live. The schedule defines the start and end date and time for the activity. If successful, it returns a status code 200. In constructing the startsAt and endsAt values, follow ISO 8601 style date-hour formats.
Update the startsAt and endsAt fields of the AB activity referenced by the provided ID.
Update the startsAt and endsAt fields of an Experience Targeting activity.

Change the priority of the activity referenced by the provided ID. This will affect the way Target evaluates the activity selection at runtime. Allowed values for priority are 0-999. If you are using low, medium, and high in the Target UI, those correspond to 0, 5, and 10, respectively. You must turn on granular priority in the settings page in order to use the 0-999 scale.
Change the priority of the AB activity referenced by the provided ID.
Change the priority of the Experience Targeting activity referenced by the provided ID.
Rename the activity referenced by the provided ID. This change will be reflected in the Target user interface after the next refresh.
Update the name of the AB activity referenced by the provided ID.
Rename the Experience Targeting activity referenced by the provided ID.

get.description: Fetch the current definition of an Automated Personalization activity as referenced by the provided ID.

put.description: Create a new Automated Personalization activity based on the specified contents, and return the created activity.

delete.description: Delete the Automated Personalization activity referenced by the provided ID.

get.description: Fetch the current definition of an AB activity as referenced by the provided ID.

put.description: Update the AB activity definition with the contents as provided in the request. This can change the state and behaviour of an existing activity.

delete.description: Delete the AB activity referenced by the provided ID.

get.description: Fetch the current definition of an AB activity as referenced by the provided ID.

put.description: Update the AB activity definition with the contents as provided in the request. This can change the state and behaviour of an existing activity.

delete.description: Delete the AB activity referenced by the provided ID.

get.description: Retrieve list of response tokens.
Retrieve list of all properties.

post.description: Creates a new Recommendations offer as defined by the request data.
Creates a new JSON offer as defined by the request data.
Creates a new content offer as defined by the request data.

get.description: Retrieve all available environments with the options to filter and sort. Use the Environments API to retrieve the environment IDs corresponding to the various host groups set for the client.

post.description: Stack multiple REST API calls together and execute them in a single batch.

get.description: Retrieve an existing authorization token to use for mbox trace or profile API access.

post.description: Create a new authorization token for capturing mbox traces or profile API access.

get.description: List all available audiences with options to filter and sort by each available field. You can use the URL parameters to define pagination properties and sort order of the list of audiences returned by this method.

post.description: Create a new audience as specified by the contents of the request and return the newly-created audience definition. Each audience definition is composed of either target or audience rules. Target rules allow the API caller to define conjunctions (OR) or disjunctions (AND) between various targeting conditions. Audience rules allow the API caller to build conjunctions (OR) or disjunctions (AND) over pre-built audiences (referred by IDs) to create even more powerful definitions. The targetRule and audienceRule attributes cannot be mixed within the same audience definition. Note: Audiences created using the API can only be edited using the API. You cannot edit an API-created audience in the UI, although you can use it within activities.
Create a new Automated Personalization activity based on the specified contents, and return the created activity.
Create a new AB activity based on the specified contents, and return the created activity.
Create a new AB activity based on the specified contents, and return the created activity.

get.summary: Get the audit log for entities filtered by modifiedBy field
get.description: the audit log for an entity for a activities, audiences or offers filtered by the name of the person who made the modifications

get.summary: Get the audit log for an entity
get.description: the audit log for an entity for a activity, audience or offer in descending order by time

get.summary: Get revision at specified moment in time
get.description: Get the latest revision that was created no later than the specified timestamp
Get revision details for a activity, audience or offer by entity id and revision id
Retrieve the list of available profile attributes and mbox parameters of type profile.
Retrieve the list of previously-created content/JSON/Recommendations offers. The parameters passed through the query string are optional and are used to indicate the sorting and filtering options.
Retrieve the list of previously-created offer templates.
Retrieves the contents of an offer template as referenced by its ID.
List all available mboxes for a specific client with the options to filter and sort.
Get the list of mbox parameters.
Retrieve a list of all hosts.
Retrieve at.js versions.
Get a list of activities created in your Target account, with the ability to filter and sort by attributes.
Retrieve the changelog events related to the activity specified by ID
Retrieve performance report data for the Automated Personalization activity referenced by the provided ID.
Retrieve orders report data for the Automated Personalization activity referenced by the provided ID.
Retrieve performance report data for the AB activity referenced by the provided ID.
Retrieve performance report data for the AB activity referenced by the provided ID.
Retrieve orders report data for the AB activity referenced by the provided ID.
Retrieve orders report data for the AB activity referenced by the provided ID.

delete.description: Delete response token referenced by the response token ID.

workspace.description: In case of premium customers (customers with multiple workspaces), it's essential to add the workspace id in every request's payload. If one is not stated, the default workspace will be used. The API consumer must have "approver" privilege on the workspace used in the request, if not the API will respond with an error indicating the lack of sufficient privileges to perform the operation.

ActivityState.description:
There are four valid activity states: approved, saved, deactivated, and deleted.

The "Approved" state has two attributes called startAt and endAt that play a vital role in what happens when you update the activity state to "Approved". startAt is the date and time that the activity is/was scheduled to begin. endAt is the date and time that the activity is/was scheduled to end.

Caution: There is approximately a 15-minute latency between the API and the UI, so when setting dates give it time. 

 

API StateStart AtEnd AtUI Status
Approvedin the pastin the futureLive
Approvedin the pastin the pastEnded
Approvedin the futurein the futureScheduled
Saved--Inactive
Deactivated--Archived
Deleted --Does Not Appear in the UI

 

Note: When setting an activity to any state using the API, the activity will stay the state that you set it to be even while the status in the UI changes. So if you set an activity to Approved and it passes the end date, the UI will show that it has ended, but the state will still be Approved.

RevisionResourceType.description:
specifies entity type to fetch revision or list of revisions

there are 3 entity types supported:

  • activity
  • audience
  • offer
